title: Ping issues with Virgin Media
body:
Hey everyone, I contacted Riot Support a week ago and after running all the tests and everything, the final response I got back was this:

https://puu.sh/yTBt5.png

"UK ISPs are no longer going through Riot Direct as they used to".

I've rang my ISP and they've been of very little help, because my ping and speed are obviously fine but not when it comes to Leauge of Legends. A week ago, I had a stable ping of 23, now my stable ping is in the 30-40s and it spikes very frequently in the 100s, which makes ranked games impossible.

It's extremely frustrating because I've spent days waiting for a response from Riot (because of Christmas/holidays) and I've rang my ISP several times too. Can someone finally take the blame and help me out? I've looked online everywhere to help fix my ping issues, to no avail.

I found this thread from 9 months ago, it was a very similar problem and it eventually got fixed because Riot contacted VM and their sub-companies to get the ping/latency issue sorted:
https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-en/EnG4O1Jg-constant-80-100ms-virgin-media-players

Could you kindly do the same. I have not been able to play league at all in my holidays and the few times that I have, my experience has been awful due to the constant ping spikes.

My tracing route:
https://puu.sh/yTBFR.png

My lag report:
https://puu.sh/ySdKQ.png

Kind regards,
Spacing.

replies.body: We can't force an ISP to make adjustments, and this does sound like a really crappy situation.  I'm curious, what would happen if you did a [DNS reconfiguration](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)?  This would change how your route to us, and potentially fix this up right away.  Let me know, and test it in a match after (the log report may not update it right away).
Hey, I tried DNS reconfiguration, unfortunately it's had no change to my ping :(...

Ah, bummer to hear that.  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) in this case so our tech team can take a closer look with you and find some more options.

I've done all the tests with support team at Riot, the response I got was at the top of this thread, this one:

https://puu.sh/yTBt5.png

Do you want me to start a new ticket?

No, you can keep chatting with your specialist but if you offer some logs they may be able to help offer some workarounds/options in the meantime.  If you haven't already, those logs can be obtained through the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367). I know ISPs can be a pain sometimes, but we could find some ways to improve things until then.

A lot of other Virgin Media users are having the very same issue, you can see it here on their forums:
http://community.virginmedia.com/t5/Gaming-Support/High-ping-in-League-of-Legends/m-p/3616135#M39209

Could you please escalate this issue? It all started about 1-2 weeks ago, for all of us and it's incredibly frustrating. I had so many plans made to play games with my friends these holidays, and I couldn't do any of it.

The new season is about to start too and the game is virtually unplayable.

I have sent all the logs to that specialist above already, with the hextech repair tool, he said there was nothing wrong with my connection from what he could see and that the only problem was, "UK ISPs are no longer going through Riot Direct as they used to".

That doesn't leave me with much of a solution sadly...

You can't force ISPs to make adjustments, that's true but you can still contact them and that's exactly how the issue was previously solved in the thread I linked above:

> [{quoted}](name=Eambo,realm=EUW,application-id=eZuvYsEr,discussion-id=EnG4O1Jg,comment-id=000d0005000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-11T19:39:35.797+0000)
>
> Previously we've always had to contact Virgin Media/LGI unfortunately. It seems their response times on their forums has been backlogged (I see a superuser mention a 1 week response time :-( ).
> 
> It looks like some routing has been lost from LGI - and we're now learning routes through a very suboptimal method. Our Riot Direct team are investigating potential options, such as pretty much blocking the route learning entirely to try and force VM traffic via another route, but we have no guarantee this will be any better.
> 
> Ideally, we'll get VM to escalate to LGI and investigate - but we're seeing if there's any way at all we can help from our end. We don't control the internet unfortunately, so we can only take traffic via the routes it's advertised :-(

I will try your DNS reconfiguration now and let you know.
Tried playing again today, still getting 40 ping (when I used to get 23) and it's still spiking up to 200-300. Feelsbad :(
